item.title: Report E-2024050568
item.description:
Report E-2024050568

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-21
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS AIR CARGO FACILITY IN MIAMI, FLORIDA, CARGO ON A WOODEN SKID WAS BEING INSPECTED FOR AIR MOVEMENT TO GUATEMALA. INSPECTION OF ONE WHITE COURIER BAG ON THE WOODEN SKID REVEALED ONE BOX CONCEALED IN THE BAG WITH A GROUND LTD QTY MARKING. THE BOX ALSO HAD A COVERED UN3480/UN3481 LITHIUM BATTERY MARK. OPEN BOX INSPECTION REVEALED THREE LITHIUM ION BATTERY POWERED REMOTE CONTROL TRUCKS. THERE ARE FOUR LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH THE REMOTE CONTROL TOY TRUCKS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS VISIBLE ON THE OUTER WHITE COURIER BAG OR SHOWN ON THE AIR WAYBILL.

item.title: Report E-2024050548
item.description:
Report E-2024050548

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: STRAFFORD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 17, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of NA1993 was damaged by unknown causes and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer interior and terminal yard. The damaged tote was lifted to gravity feed into an additional tote. The damaged tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal. All spent absorbents, clean up debris and absorbent pads were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024050553
item.description:
Report E-2024050553

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 17, 2024, two (2) one-gallon pails of UN3149 were crushed in transit and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GME) to remediate the impacted site. GME personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3149-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. All damaged containers were set aside and placed into two (2) 55-gallon drums. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All three (3) 55-gallon drums were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050596
item.description:
Report E-2024050596

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-27T21:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-17
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 17, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2920 was damaged due to a load strap failure and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services, Inc. (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the trailer. All impacted materials were contained in the same one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024050528
item.description:
Report E-2024050528

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately seven (7) gallons of material released from four (4) 5-gallon metal pails due to a forklift puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents into four (4) 5-gallon poly pails. The damaged 5-gallon metal pails were overpacked into four (4) 10-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2024050495

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-19
  • City: PORT ALLEN
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee arrived at Veolia's ten day intransit facility to prepare for travel to another office for the week when they noticed a large spill in the warehouse. The employee determined that the spill was from one 55-1A2 open top metal drum containing "UN1325, Waste Flammable Solids, Organic, n.o.s. (Petroleum Hydrocarbons), 4.1, III, RQ (D001)." The leak was traced to a pinhole puncture in the drum. The poor integrity of the container previously went unnoticed because the puncture did not puncture the exterior paint; a blister had formed and kept the liquid from spilling until the blister ruptured. Approximately 5 gallons of liquid was released until the leak stopped on its own over the weekend and was discovered the following morning. While the employee moved the drum to be overpacked and was taking pictures of the incident, the drum began to leak again from the same blister. The employee overpacked the drum, put down oil dry to clean the spill, made sure no other drums were also leaking, and contacted management to inform them of the incident.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of cupric sulfate was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 434 pounds of product to the trailer interior and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Rose Rock Environmental (RRE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew used a pressure washer and absorbents to remediate the site and containerized all waste in one (1) 55-gallon drum. RRE personnel transferred the contents of the damaged tote.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of corrosive liquid was punctured by a nail in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: Coopersburg
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PENN TANK LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver failed to properly secure a delivery fitting to the UST coupler. During delivery, the fitting dislodged from the coupler allowing release of approx 50 gallons of Fuel Oil affecting the concrete delivery pad and the surrounding asphalt parking lot and a portion of asphalt alley, as well as a 15' x 6" area of grass and dirt. Loose product was contained with spill response materials and booms to prevent spread or storm drain intrusion. Affected areas were treated with oil absorbents that were drummed and removed from the site for disposal by Hepaco.

  • City: Milan
  • State: RI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Shortly after pushback of American Airlines Flight 199 from the gate, passenger in seat 27L had a powerbank that began to overheat. The crew put the battery in the fire containment bag as a precaution and returned to the gate to remove the battery from the aircraft. The Captain dropped the powerbank out the Flight Deck window to the Ramp. No injuries or damages were reported by the crew. After the battery was removed the aircraft taxied out and departed MXP without further issue. Captain Sorenson wishes to extend thanks to MXP personnel for quick and efficient coordination in handling the Incident. 1

  • City: NEW ORLEANS
  • State: LA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 208750
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 26th, 2024, at 05:57 hours, personnel in the CSX Gentilly Yard reported a derailment involving loaded tank cars of NA1993, Fuel Oil, Combustible Liquid, PGIII. One of the five derailed tank cars, NATX 301139, was on its side and found to be leaking from the Vacuum Relief Valve. All other derailed cars were found to be leak free. SPSI, a CSX response contractor, and two CSX Managers of Hazardous Materials, responded the incident. Response personnel partially plugged and fully contained the release upon arrival. Once the car was rerailed to an upright the position, the release was stopped. CSX subsequently transloaded, cleaned and purged this car in preparation for the car being dismantled onsite for scrap; repair costs exceeded the value of the car.

  • Description: On 5/8/24 at approximately 1130, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 294822 at the hub facility in Anchorage, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consists two plastic jerricans, individually overpacked into fiberboard boxes. One of the shipments appeared to have a loose closure, resoulting in spillage from the top. The damaged drum was placed in a salvage drum and the entire shipment is being held, awaiting an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • City: YORK
  • State: PA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was moving containers at the 10 day in-transit storage area with a forklift. The employee needed to move the 951H2 overpack container but due to the issues with utilizing certain drum carts to move these, the employee chose to widen the forks and lift the drum utilizing the edges on the container. Upon lifting with the forks, the container slipped from the forks landing on its side. The employee quickly righted the container with the forklift and tightened the closure, but an estimated 1/2 gallon had leaked out. The 95 gallon overpack contained one 55 gallon drum inside.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding (2) crushed and leaking poly drums containing hazardous product, InterCoat® ChemGuard 320L Thor. The drums were shrink-wrapped together by the Shipper and fell over during transit as a result of inadequate preparation for transportation / improper blocking and bracing. This resulted in approximately 1-gallon of product releasing onto the wooden trailer floor in a 5’x5’ area. A Contractor neutralized the release with Acid Gator and overpacked the damaged drums. In total, two 55-gallon DF’s were generated for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 8ft-by-1ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that five (5) gallons of material was released due to improper loading of the freight that damaged two (2) 5-gallon metal pails. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and then gathered the spent material. The recovered impacted absorbents were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal. The ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 14th, the owner of Oregon Valley Farms, Josh, came into the front counter to personally drop off some of these shipments. Previously the station had discovered undeclared shipments that were of similar packages He told the counter agent that he had changed his process that there would be no liquid nitrogen in the package when shipped. After Josh left a visual inspection of the packages he dropped off was done and one hadhad visible frost on the outside of the package. The package was opened up and as suspected there was liquid nitrogen in the package. There was a significant amount of vapor coming out of the package and as the vapor settled liquid nitrogen in the bottom of the package. was visible. The package is being held pending disposition.

  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-6ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to crushed freight damaging one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug. Clean Harbors personnel used a neutralizer and absorbent to collect the released material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon and one (1) 30- gallon poly drums. An impacted pallet was broken down and placed into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING. THE UNLOADER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE LIDS ON EACH ONE OF THE INNER 2.5 GALLON PLASTIC CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 OF A TURN AND 4 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS NO INNER PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX.

  • Description: Gene Manguso Operations Supervisor called to report a leaking pail on the dock floor in front of Bay Door 28. Gene stated one of his workers when to move the box and found that the box was a little saturated and appeared to have been leaking with in the box. Gene stated the 1 gallon pail in the box was in a bag and looked to have been leaking in the bag. Gene stated he removed the box from the dock floor and placed the pail in a recovery pail and placed it in the OSD. Safety advised Gene any time a spill is found it will need to be reported to safety immediately. Gene stated he would let safet y know before anything is done next time on a spill. Gene stated the product did not spill on the dock floor and was contained to the box. Update Gene stated it looked to be a lose cap on the pail that caused the leak.
